lines.text:
[referring to Henri]
One of them's a frog, boys. Why don't you say something, froggy!
Merde.
What the hell does that mean?

[to Rocky]
To most people, it's an insult. But to you, I'd say it's a compliment.

[after the Canadians finished singing a mocking version of 'Yankee Doodle']
Corporal Peacock, your stripes are not a licence to behave like an ass. There will be no more insulting or derogatory remarks about the Yanks, is that clear?
Yes, sir.

[addressing the Canadians]
There will be no more insulting or derogatory remarks about the Yanks.
Oh, would ordinary insults be acceptable, sir?
The human body has numerous vulnerable points.
[Rockman charges at O'Neill]

[while hitting Rockman]
The elbow, the ribs, and the neck.
Including... the solar plexus.
[Kicks Rockman in the gut]
And many other points.
It's true you are a great powerful beast, but you'll note how his own size and weight can be used against him.
[Canadians applaud]
Hand-to-Hand Combat Instructor.

[Referring to Headquarters]
Is there a chance, sir? Have you got friends up there?
No. But at this point I don't care about making any more enemies.
They say you find what something is worth when you pay for it.
[Upon meeting the rowdy, unkempt American troops for the first time]
God save the King.
God save us all.

[to Major Bricker]
You've been in-and-out of nine different camps because you're the biggest chiseler, hustler, and scrounger in the whole Army. Well, in ten days our first recruits arrive, and whatever they need, and whatever this camp needs, you're going to supply. How you do it is your own business. So start hustling.
Faith moves mountains. It doesn't take them.
Major, when you address me, take that cigar out of your mouth.

[Tugs at Pvt. MacDonald's Kilt]
Here. Your petticoat is showing.

[Henri stumbles as the men are fjording an ice-cold Italian stream]
"Oh, merde, there goes my chance to be a daddy!"

[Amused]
"Don't worry about it, Frog..."

[Looking up the side of a cliff in Italy]
"Holy cow, it's straight up!"

[Seriously]
"What's the beef? It's only a mile high."
...The most memorable compliment came from their commandin' officer; and he referred to us as Der Teufel Brigade'... Members of The Devil's Brigade.
[Toasting Col. Frederick]
Long life to the Devil!
[the Brigade cheers their Colonel]

[Sarcastically to Capt. Rose]
Nobody likes a promiscuous rattlesnake, eh, Captain?
